PostToolUse.description: Validate epic closure prerequisites before marking epic as Done

hooks.prompt: If this update is marking an EPIC as Done (not a regular ticket), verify: 1) All sub-tickets are Done or Cancelled, 2) No workarounds or temporary solutions were shipped, 3) Business value was delivered. Epic closure requires all sub-tickets complete. If any sub-ticket is incomplete, BLOCK the epic closure and report which tickets need attention.

Stop.description: End-of-session summary with code review notes and Linear reminders

hooks.prompt:
Before stopping, provide a brief end-of-session summary:

1. **Code review notes**: Check `git diff --name-only` for modified files. For files in production code paths (src/, lib/, app/, services/, modules/, controllers/) that are code files (.ts, .js, .tsx, .jsx), note any TODO/FIXME comments, empty catch blocks, or console.log statements. Present findings as a short list, or state 'None' if clean. Skip this check entirely for: scripts/, tests/, __tests__/, *.test.*, *.spec.*, config files, documentation, and non-code changes.

2. **Linear ticket status**: If this session used workflow commands (/adaptation, /implementation, /testing, /documentation, /codereview, /security-review) on a Linear ticket, remind the user to verify ticket status is updated.

If no code changes were made and no workflow commands were used, approve stopping without comment.

SessionStart.description: Inject PM workflow context and skill reminders at session start
